memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID winid=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=wxLC_REPORT, const wxValidator &validator=wxDefaultValidator, const wxString &name=wxListCtrlNameStr)
memberdef.name: wxListView

briefdescription.para: Constructor, creating and showing a listview control.

parameterdescription.para: Parent window. Must not be NULL.
Window identifier. The value wxID_ANY indicates a default value.
Window position. If wxDefaultPosition is specified then a default position is chosen.
Window size. If wxDefaultSize is specified then the window is sized appropriately.

briefdescription.para: Resets the column image after calling this function, no image will be shown.

parameterdescription.para: the column to clear image for

briefdescription.para: Sets focus to the item with the given index.
Returns the first selected item in a (presumably) multiple selection control.

detaileddescription.para: Together with GetNextSelected() it can be used to iterate over all selected items in the control.

simplesect.para: The first selected item, if any, -1 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the currently focused item or -1 if none.
Used together with GetFirstSelected() to iterate over all selected items in the control.

simplesect.para: Returns the next selected item or -1 if there are no more of them.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the item with the given index is selected, false otherwise.
Selects or unselects the given item.

parameterdescription.para: the item to select or unselect
if true (default), selects the item, otherwise unselects it

briefdescription.para: Sets the column image for the specified column.

detaileddescription.para: To use the column images, the control must have a valid image list with at least one image.

parameterdescription.para: the column to set image for
the index of the column image in the controls image list

briefdescription.para: This class currently simply presents a simpler to use interface for the wxListCtrl it can be thought of as a fa√ßade for that complicated class.

detaileddescription.para: Using it is preferable to using wxListCtrl directly whenever possible because in the future some ports might implement wxListView but not the full set of wxListCtrl features.
Other than different interface, this class is identical to wxListCtrl. In particular, it uses the same events, same window styles and so on.
